aece9a8a-a27f-43af-b1c2-e99d9bfe4e0b.description: The earner of this badge demonstrated an understanding of the Agile Manifesto (4 values and 12 principles for software development), terminology, philosophy, and methodologies by applying the concepts to develop a software solution with consideration of the advantages and disadvantages of the Agile processes.
aece9a8a-a27f-43af-b1c2-e99d9bfe4e0b.name: Agile Software Development Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by United States Air Force

alignments.name: Agile Principles and Methodologies
alignments.description: e-Learning course that covers the fundamental Agile concepts (8 Agile values and 12 Agile principles), the 5 phases of the Agile project management model, the most common Agile methodologies and frameworks, and the key activities for managing an Agile project. (NOTE: SkillPort is CAC enabled)

alignments.name: Introduction to Agile Software Development
alignments.description: e-Learning course that covers agile software development as well as the principles and values behind the agile manifesto. (NOTE: SkillPort is CAC enabled)

alignments.name: Introduction to Agile & Scrum
alignments.description: A Udemy course that covers the Agile Manifesto, common roles associated with Agile methods and Scrum. (NOTE: Udemy requires an account, which can be signed up for through the Airmen Coders initiative, www.airmencoders.us)

alignments.name: SENG 593 Agile Software Systems
alignments.description: A 10-week graduate-level distance learning course hosted by the Air Force Institute of Technology (AFIT).

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a training course that covers Agile concepts, terminology, philosophy, and methodologies. At a minimum, it must cover the Agile Manifesto, common roles associated with Agile methods, and 12 Agile principles and values for software development.
Write a personal reflection describing the application of Agile concepts to a non-Agile development process either from personal experience or a hypothetical application to an existing process.
Complete the Agile Software Development Fundamentals rubric.
The rubric was reviewed by Earner's supervisor and recommended for the award of the Agile Software Development Fundamentals badge.
For additional information on the Cyberspace Support digital badge initiative and the earning process, please see the linked information sheet.

51319d78-022b-4966-b38b-9c6aae7ecff8.description: Earners of this badge demonstrated foundational knowledge of teaching and learning theories required to perform as an effective instructor in the student-centered classroom. Earners demonstrated knowledge of how to select and implement instructional strategies and assessments, use technology, and develop professional learning communities.
51319d78-022b-4966-b38b-9c6aae7ecff8.name: Air University Teaching & Learning Center: Teaching Essentials

issuer.summary: issued by United States Air Force

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the Teaching Essentials Course offered by Air University Teaching & Learning Center. Earners may take either the multi-day hybrid class or self-paced asynchronous version.
Pass the post-assessment after the hybrid course with a minimum of 70% or earn a minimum score of 70% on the post-assessment for each lesson of the asynchronous course.

03f1c358-3b06-4ebb-95b5-a13324435ad4.description: Earners of this badge understand how the United States Air Force applies Digital Engineering concepts to craft warfighting and support capabilities. Earners understand how the Air Force's integrated environment and tools promote transparency and teamwork among acquisition, engineering and operational stakeholders. Earners understand basic modeling concepts, standards, architectures, lifecycle strategies, processes and policy, as well as expected benefits and associated challenges.
03f1c358-3b06-4ebb-95b5-a13324435ad4.name: Digital Engineering Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by United States Air Force

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Digital Engineering Fundamentals learning path.  This learning path covers Integrated Environment, Modeling Concepts, Standards/Data/Architecture, Lifecycle Strategies & Processes, Policy & Guidance and some case studies.
